alert.note: Alert for Mayaguez and Vicinity; North Central; Northwest; San Juan and Vicinity (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Excessive Heat Watch issued June 16 at 11:23AM ADT until June 18 at 6:00PM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM AST THIS AFTERNOON... ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...A watch is in effect through Sunday afternoon due to possible excessive heat index values reaching or exceeding 111 degrees Fahrenheits each afternoon. * WHERE...For both the watch and warning, the lower elevations of Puerto Rico from western Puerto Rico and the Culebrinas River Valley to Levittown. * WHEN...For the warning, from 10 AM AST to 5 PM. For the watch, from now through Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...The combination of hot temperatures and high humidity will create dangerous situations in which heat related illnesses are likely. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Ample sunshine today will amplify the effects of the high temperatures.
info.instruction: Take extra precautions, if you work or spend time outside. When possible, reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear light weight and loose fitting clothing when possible and drink plenty of water. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency, call 9 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Mayaguez and Vicinity; North Central; Northwest; San Juan and Vicinity
